p: The characteristics of the studies here reviewed include ten entries for each: article type, study design, data sources, analysis method, study aim; study population, study theme, intervention, outcome data and outcome measures. Table 2 provides a detailed overview of the 32 studies considered in the review. Geographically the studies varied widely across the countries of the continents of Africa, Asia, Europe, North and Central America and Australia, so as to ensure a wide international basis, hence adding robustness to the findings. The designs varied among the studies and included empirical evidence, systematic reviews; scenario-based assessments, narrative reviews; exploratory studies; survey-based studies; formative research, case studies and ecological study design. Other measures considered in the appraisal of selected studies included reporting style, outcome measures, study design, the fidelity of protocol and possible conflicts of interest.
